fact: Bananas are technically berries.
description: Botanically, a berry develops from a single ovary of a flower. Bananas qualify, but strawberries do not.

fact: Octopuses have three hearts.
description: Two hearts pump blood to the gills, while the third pumps it to the rest of the body.

fact: Sharks existed before trees.
description: Sharks have been around for over 400 million years. The first trees appeared around 350 million years ago.

fact: Honey never spoils.
description: Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still edible.

fact: Wombats produce cube-shaped poop.
description: Their unique intestinal elasticity shapes the feces into cubes, which prevents them from rolling away.

fact: Sea otters hold hands while sleeping.
description: They do this to avoid drifting away from each other while floating in the water.

fact: Butterflies taste with their feet.
description: They have taste sensors on their feet to help them identify suitable plants to lay eggs on.

fact: A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
description: Venus takes longer to rotate once on its axis than it does to orbit the Sun.

fact: Hot water can freeze faster than cold water.
description: This phenomenon is called the Mpemba effect, and scientists are still studying why it happens.

fact: Cows have best friends.
description: Studies show cows become stressed when separated from their preferred companions.

fact: Turtles can breathe through their butts.
description: Some species perform cloacal respiration, absorbing oxygen through their rear ends underwater.

fact: The Eiffel Tower grows taller in summer.
description: Heat causes the iron structure to expand, making it up to 15 cm taller.

fact: There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way.
description: Scientists estimate around 3 trillion trees on Earth compared to 100–400 billion stars in our galaxy.

fact: Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins.
description: Sloths can slow their heart rate and hold their breath for up to 40 minutes.

fact: A cloud can weigh over a million kilograms.
description: Though they appear light, clouds are made of millions of water droplets.

fact: The human body glows in the dark.
description: Our bodies emit tiny amounts of visible light due to biochemical reactions, but it’s too faint for our eyes to detect.

fact: Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire.
description: Teaching at Oxford began around 1096, while the Aztec Empire was founded in 1428.

fact: Your stomach gets a new lining every few days.
description: This prevents it from digesting itself with its strong acids.

fact: There are more possible chess games than atoms in the observable universe.
description: The number of possible chess games is estimated to be around 10^120.

fact: Scotland has over 400 words for snow.
description: The Scots language includes dozens of descriptive words for different types of snow.

fact: The fingerprints of a koala are nearly identical to humans.
description: They are so similar that they can sometimes confuse crime scene investigators.

fact: You can’t hum while holding your nose.
description: Humming requires airflow through your nasal passages, which is blocked when you pinch your nose.

fact: The shortest war in history lasted 38 minutes.
description: The Anglo-Zanzibar War in 1896 ended in under an hour.

fact: A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance.
description: The term reflects their bright pink color and dramatic appearance.

fact: Your brain uses about 20% of your body's energy.
description: Despite being only 2% of body weight, the brain is extremely energy-demanding.

fact: Pineapples take about two years to grow.
description: Each pineapple grows from a single flower and takes up to 24 months to mature.

fact: There are more fake flamingos in the world than real ones.
description: Plastic lawn flamingos once outnumbered the actual bird population.

fact: The moon has moonquakes.
description: Seismic activity on the moon can last for up to 10 minutes.

fact: Some metals explode when they touch water.
description: Alkali metals like sodium react violently with water.

fact: An astronaut can grow taller in space.
description: Without gravity compressing the spine, astronauts can grow up to 2 inches taller.
